text: The 1999 Corby Borough Council election took place on 6 May 1999 to elect members of Corby Borough Council in Northamptonshire, England. It was the first election be held under new ward boundaries. The Labour retained overall control of the council, which it had held continuously since 1979. ==Ward-by- ward results== ===Central Ward (3 seats)=== Location of Central ward in Corby ===Danesholme Ward (3 seats)=== Location of Danesholme ward ===East Ward (2 seats)=== Location of East ward ===Hazlewood Ward (3 seats)=== Location of Hazlewood ward ===Hillside Ward (1 seat)=== Location of Hillside ward ===Kingswood Ward (3 seats)=== Location of Kingswood ward ===Lloyds Ward (3 seats)=== Location of Lloyds ward ===Lodge Park (3 seats)=== Location of Lodge Park ward ===Rural East Ward (2 seats)=== Location of Rural East ward ===Rural North Ward (1 seats)=== Location of Rural North ward ===Rural West Ward (1 seat)=== Location of Rural West ward ===Shire Lodge (2 seats)=== Location of Shire Lodge ward ===West Ward (2 seats)=== Location of West ward ==References== Category:1999 English local elections 1999 Category:1990s in Northamptonshire
title: 1999 Corby Borough Council election
